intro: Alangium kinabaluense, commonly known as the Borneo moonseed, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Borneo. It belongs to the family Berberidaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, greenish-yellow flowers. The plant produces berries that are typically red or orange when mature, containing several seeds. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in primary rainforests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
